meanings.definition: A liquid or lotion, especially one made with oil, for rubbing on the body to relieve pain.
meanings.sent1: After playing soccer, I applied liniment to my sore muscles.
meanings.sent2: My grandmother uses liniment to soothe her arthritis pain.
meanings.sent3: The liniment smelled like mint and made me feel like a walking candy cane.
meanings.sent4: The liniment was a magic potion, easing the ache in my joints.
meanings.sent5: The liniment was a cooling balm on my sunburned skin.

meanings.definition: A medicinal fluid rubbed into the skin to relieve pain or stiffness.
meanings.sent1: The liniment my mom gave me helped my sprained ankle.
meanings.sent2: Athletes often use liniment to alleviate muscle soreness.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally mistook the liniment for lotion and smelled like a medicine cabinet.
meanings.sent4: The liniment worked like a charm, easing the tension in my shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The strong scent of the liniment cleared my sinuses as well as my pain.
